citation.article-title: Facklamia miroungae sp. nov., from a juvenile southern elephant seal (Mirounga leonina).
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Facklamia miroungae sp. nov.
Facklamia miroungae (mi.roung'ae. N.L. gen. n. miroungae of Mirounga, named because the organism was isolated from the southern elephant seal, Mirounga leonina)
Cells are Gram-positive, ovoid in shape (approx. 0.8-0.9 μm in diameter) and occur in pairs or short chains.
Colonies on blood agar are γ-haemolytic, small (<0.5 mm in diameter after 24 h), circular, entire, shiny, convex and grey in colour.

Acid is produced from glucose and trehalose, but not from mannitol, maltose, sorbitol, lactose, raffinose, glycogen, pullulan, melibiose, melezitose, L-arabinose, D-arabitol, tagatose, methyl β-D-glucopyranoside, cyclodextrin or sucrose.
Activity is detected for arginine dihydrolase, alaninephenylalanine-proline arylamidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, leucine arylamidase and urease.
Weak activity is observed for valine arylamidase, cysteine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, phosphoaminidase, acid phosphatase and glycyl-tryptophan arylamidase.
Alkaline phosphatase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase activities are weak or absent.

No activity is observed for esterase [C-4], ester lipase [C-8], lipase [C-14], trypsin, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase, β-mannosidase, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, bgalactosidase and β-glucuronidase.
Aesculin, gelatin and hippurate are not hydrolysed.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Isolated from a juvenile elephant seal.
The type strain, A/G13/99/2T (=CCUG 42728T=CIP 106764T), was isolated from a nasal swab.
